page.title: 06The Three Crosses
page.content: There are 3 crosses in Crowcombe. One is the{Market Cross.}This was once the centre of the old village market and dates from{1226.}You can see signs of wear on its steps from those who sat on them selling their produce. This cross was to remind people to be good{neighbours.} Outside the church porch is the original{Churchyard Cross}with its sculptured figures. The top was damaged and has been replaced. One figure is St.John the Baptist. The woman being blessed by a mitred bishop is probably the prioress of Studley. The{Memorial Cross}remembering two world wars was moved to its present site near the{Church House}by Crowcombe parishioners after the 1939 _ 1945 war in grateful memory of those who served and did not return.
